1.text: Of man are arrangements of the heart, And from Jehovah an answer of the tongue.

2.text: All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes, And Jehovah is pondering the spirits.

3.text: Roll unto Jehovah thy works, And established are thy purposes,

4.text: All things hath Jehovah wrought for Himself, And also the wicked worketh for a day of evil.

5.text: An abomination to Jehovah is every proud one of heart, Hand to hand he is not acquitted.

6.text: In kindness and truth pardoned is iniquity, And in the fear of Jehovah Turn thou aside from evil.

7.text: When a man’s ways please Jehovah, even his enemies, He causeth to be at peace with him.

8.text: Better is a little with righteousness, Than abundance of increase without justice.

9.text: The heart of man deviseth his way, And Jehovah establisheth his step.

10.text: An oath is on the lips of a king, In judgment his mouth trespasseth not.

11.text: A just beam and balances are Jehovah’s, His work are all the stones of the bag.

12.text: An abomination to kings is doing wickedness, For by righteousness is a throne established.

13.text: The delight of kings are righteous lips, And whoso is speaking uprightly he loveth,

14.text: The fury of a king is messengers of death, And a wise man pacifieth it.

15.text: In the light of a king’s face is life, And his good-will is as a cloud of the latter rain.

16.text: To get wisdom—how much better than gold, And to get understanding to be chosen than silver!

17.text: A highway of the upright is, ‘Turn from evil,’ Whoso is preserving his soul is watching his way.

18.text: Before destruction is pride, And before stumbling—a haughty spirit.’

19.text: Better is humility of spirit with the poor, Than to apportion spoil with the proud.

20.text: The wise in any matter findeth good, And whoso is trusting in Jehovah, O his happiness.

21.text: To the wise in heart is called, ‘Intelligent,’ And sweetness of lips increaseth learning.

22.text: A fountain of life is understanding to its possessors, The instruction of fools is folly.

23.text: The heart of the wise causeth his mouth to act wisely, And by his lips he increaseth learning,

24.text: Sayings of pleasantness are a honeycomb, Sweet to the soul, and healing to the bone.

25.text: There is a way right before a man, And its latter end—ways of death.

26.text: A labouring man hath laboured for himself, For his mouth hath caused him to bend over it.

27.text: A worthless man is preparing evil, And on his lips—as a burning fire.

28.text: A froward man sendeth forth contention, A tale-bearer is separating a familiar friend.

29.text: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, And hath causeth him to go in a way not good.

30.text: Consulting his eyes to devise froward things, Moving his lips he hath accomplished evil.

31.text: A crown of beauty are grey hairs, In the way of righteousness it is found.

32.text: Better is the slow to anger than the mighty, And the ruler over his spirit than he who is taking a city.

33.text: Into the centre is the lot cast, And from Jehovah is all its judgment!
